Detailed Description

Class for executing LiquiBase via the command line.

String [] liquibase.commandline.Main.fixupArgs ( String[]  args  )  [protected]

On windows machines, it splits args on '=' signs.

Put it back like it was.

00135         List<String> fixedArgs = new ArrayList<String>();

00137         for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
00138             String arg = args[i];
00139             if (arg.startsWith("--") && !arg.contains("=")) {
00140                 String nextArg = null;
00141                 if (i + 1 < args.length) {
00142                     nextArg = args[i + 1];
00143                 }
00144                 if (nextArg != null && !nextArg.startsWith("--") && !isCommand(nextArg)) {
00145                     arg = arg + "=" + nextArg;
00146                     i++;
00147                 }
00148             }
